name: FMP Construction Site Perimeter Inspection Checklist

questions.description: Weather Conditions
Perimeter fencing is intact, secure, and free of damage (no gaps, leaning sections, or easy entry)
All gates are closed and secured outside of operational hours, preventing unauthorized entry.
"No Trespassing" or "Authorized Personnel Only" signage is clearly visible and correctly positioned.
Danger/Hazard warning signs (e.g., "Hard Hat Area", "Construction Zone") are at all access points
No evidence of unauthorized entry or vandalism (e.g., cut fences, broken locks)
Clear and safe pedestrian pathways are maintained outside the perimeter (no obstructions, debris)
Designated pedestrian detours (if any) are clearly marked, well-lit, safely navigable.
No construction materials, equipment or debris posing trip hazards or falling objects risk.
Adequate lighting is present along public walkways adjacent to perimeter.
Measures in place to prevent dust, excessive noise, or other pollutants impacting public areas
Signage related to site safety and public awareness is in good order, legible, and not obscured
General cleanliness of the visible perimeter area (no litter, waste, or discarded materials)
Waste bins/dumpsters are not overflowing and appear to be managed properly (lids closed)
Erosion and sediment control measures (e.g., silt fending, straw bales) appear intact and functional
No visible pooling of water or evidence of improper drainage causing issues outside perimeter
Vehicle access points are free of excessive mud or debris tracking onto university roadways

fields.description: Vehicle access points free of excessive mud/debris

questions.description: Required permits, health & safety notices, project info clearly displayed at main entry points
Emergency contact information for the contract and FMP is visible and up-to-date
External signage clearly displays the construction company name and primary contact details
Site Security and Demarcation
Public Safety and Access (Considering "Sudbury Legal Case" Implications
Site Orderliness and Environmental Controls
Regulatory and Information Displays
Enter today's date and time
